domain

Class Huffman

  • java.lang.Object
    • domain.CompressionAlgorithm
      • domain.Huffman

  • public final class Huffman
extends CompressionAlgorithm
    A CompressionAlgorithm implementation which uses canonical Huffman coding. For more details see compressData and decompressData.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int OFFSET_CWLENGTHS_LENGTH
      Offset (in bytes) from the beginning of compressed files, indicating where the value of codewordLenghtsLength (needed in TreeRepresentation) will be written.
      static int OFFSET_ORIG_DATA_LENGTH
      Offset (in bytes) from the beginning of compressed files, indicating where the length of the original data (in bytes) will be written.
      static int OFFSET_TREE
      Offset (in bytes) from the beginning of compressed files, indicating where the TreeRepresentation of the Huffman tree used for compression will be written.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Huffman() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BitSequence compressData(byte[] originalData)
      Compresses the given data by first computing a canonical Huffman code, and then using it as compression code.
      byte[] decompressData(byte[] compressedData)
      Decompresses the given compressed data by first building the canonical Huffman tree that was used for compression (using its representation, included in the compressed data) and then using it as decompression code.
      java.lang.String getDescription()
      Returns a description of the CompressionAlgorithm.
      java.lang.String getExtension()
      Returns the file extension used by the CompressionAlgorithm (for compressed files).
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns a short name for the CompressionAlgorithm.

    • Method Detail

      • compressData

        public BitSequence compressData(byte[] originalData)
        Compresses the given data by first computing a canonical Huffman code, and then using it as compression code. The compressed data will include (in this order): - int: length (in bytes) of the original (uncompressed) file; - unsigned byte: length (in bytes) of the first part (codewordLengths) of the representation of the canonical Huffman tree used for compression (the total length of the tree representation can be calculated from this, see TreeRepresentation); - unsigned byte: unused bits in the last byte of the compressed data (freeBits variable of the BitSequence class); - representation of the canonical Huffman tree; - compressed representation of the original data.
        Specified by:
        compressData in class CompressionAlgorithm
        Parameters:
        originalData - The data to be compressed.
        Returns:
        A bit sequence corresponding to the compressed data.

      • decompressData

        public byte[] decompressData(byte[] compressedData)
        Decompresses the given compressed data by first building the canonical Huffman tree that was used for compression (using its representation, included in the compressed data) and then using it as decompression code.
        Specified by:
        decompressData in class CompressionAlgorithm
        Parameters:
        compressedData - The compressed data to be decompressed.
        Returns:
        The original, uncompressed data.
